Topic.Title: Silly old middle class .... doesn't even realize that Obama WANTS to RAISE their TAXES

Message.Msg: you should take the time to get your GED...did you drink the kookaid? the debt ceiling means nothing...we owe less than 7 Trillion in real debt ...to people we HAVE to pay back...like Japan, China and mutual funds...the other 9 Trillion is owed to ourselves...in social security, medicare and FDIC trust funds...they could be written off tomorrow with ZERO impact....because you are uneducated I will put this in lower class trailer park terms for you... say you and your new bride just had a baby and you were living in your trailer.....you decide (because you are nit wits) that you want to save for college for the little one....you put $100 in a cookie jar every month....but when the rent comes due each month you take out the cash and put an IOU in its place...and you keep doing that for years...and when the kid is ready for college you have a big pile of worthless paper....that is what congress has done for 35 years.....all the excess money collected from paychecks for social security and medicare and all the money the banks sent in to the FDIC for their insurance payments was put in to the govt checkbook and spent.....then they issued treasury bonds (your college fund IOU's) back to the agencies.....since social security and medicare are 'pay as you go'....there is no need to keep up this charade.....just write them off and save the 400 billion a year in interest that is counted as additional debt on our govt deficit....class dismissed! hold the mayo!

Topic.Title: reagan raised ceiling 11 times.filthy #$%$

Message.Msg: Hitch you were the one saying the deficit was no big deal when it was republicans running it up. Your ratio argument has shown to be inadequate. Once the GDP went down the ration naturally increased and the fallacy of that argument was clear to all..except you it seems. Debt is debt and there is no reason that as a nation we should assume that the future is going to be any better equipped to pay for it than the present. You argued against a balanced budget before and you know enough economics to know that when the economy needs a boost federal debt increases to provide stimulus. The fault is not paying it down when times are good but instead giving tax breaks to rich cronies. Yes Congress does raise the debt ceiling and they also decide the broad areas where spending will be done. They also are the ones responsible if there is a default or a degradation of bond ratings. They have made it clear that they will not follow Obama leadership or even their own leadership and some are bent on destroying the economy in hopes of bringing down the government system we have. That is your tea party for you. Your hero Reagan started this starve the beast pogrom and Bush Jr carried it on for the neocons that were the puppet masters for both. Neither of those presidents had enough economic sense to understand what was happening and were more interested in exerting influence and power than economic well being of the nation. Both provided feel good programs by running up debt after debt for future taxpayers. Obama is not going to be able to correct that in two terms and Romney/Ryan knew that too and never proposed to balance the budget. By 2008 the hole was so deep that they thought no recovery was possible but once again the democrats have saved the nation from economic downfall and thwarted the republican plans to subjugate the working class Americans. Americans have spoken, they will not stand by and be trickled on. Obamas reelection is the middle class striking back. Yes it is class warfare started by republicans who divided the economic pie in favor of the well to do. Republicans can step up and be constructive, offer and support the good ideas they are capable of or step aside but those that continue to try to obstruct recovery will be voted out. That is how revolution is conducted in a democratic society not with the guns and threats offered by the right wing fringe.

Message.Title: Reagan raised the debt ceiling 18, not 11 times

Message.Title: Terror Threat: Right Wing Filth
Message.Msg: Radical right wing whaco filth like SW, zevoter, dumpobamie, whitest white, flippant 1, mama say it aint so, and the dozens of other extremist trash should concern any sane person. Political kooks are unstable and dangerous. READ THIS !! 17 Years After Oklahoma City Bombing, Right-Wing Extremism Is still a significant domestic terror threat. Timothy McVeigh and co-conspirator Terry Nichols detonated 4,800 pounds of homemade explosives under the Alfred P. Murrah Federal Building’s daycare center in downtown Oklahoma City. The explosion resulted in 168 dead, 680 injured and over $652 million in damage. The Oklahoma City bombing was the deadliest terrorist attacks in U.S. history until 9/11. McVeigh said that he attacked the Murrah building, which held the local offices of the DEA, ATF, Social Security, and the Army and Marine recruiting offices, because of his hatred of the federal government, opposition to gun control laws and anger at the FBI for its actions during the Waco Siege of 1993. McVeigh was found guilty on eleven counts of murder and conspiracy in 1997 and was executed by lethal injection on June 11, 2001. Though the terrorist attack on Oklahoma City happened nearly two decades ago, right-wing extremist terrorism remains a significant domestic threat to American security. The Department of Homeland Security released a report in 2009 stating that the economic and political climate bears important similarities to the conditions of the early 1990s when right-wing extremism experienced a dramatic resurgence. These conditions, including the public debate around hot-button issues such as immigration, gun control, and abortion, along with the election of the first African-American president, present “unique drivers for right-wing radicalization and recruitment,” the report said. Homeland Security Secretary Janet Napolitano eventually ordered the report withdrawn because of significant political backlash from mainstream conservatives. But the report, which was originally commissioned by the Bush administration, also found that “lone wolves and small terrorist cells embracing violent rightwing extremist ideology are the most dangerous domestic terrorism threat in the United States.” A look at terrorist incidents since the Oklahoma City bombing, including both successful and disrupted ideologically-motivated attacks, backs up the conclusions of the DHS report.

Topic.Title: Statement of the Day.

Message.Msg: What else would you expect this R. from N.C. to say. It's just more of the same protect the wealth of the rich at the expense of the middle class (250K) and below, and the social security program recipients (less you forget, the Romney vouchers in place of medicare policy). Now the losing Republican party says no new taxes on the wealthy, (400K and above), unless it goes to reducing the deficits. Deficits they began under the failed policies of George W. Well all tax revenues are the way the Gov. pays for future debt. what revenues are remaining go to pay off old bills. not the other way around. That's just common sense, but common sense is not common in the GOP, the losing party of the 2%. Yes, this is class conflict, it has occurred throughout history, and always at the demise of the very wealthy minority,for the greater good of the majority, and I'm not defending the lazy loafing freeloaders, who can't remember the last time they had a W-2 form. Topic.Title: Futures are cripping up in Asia.

Message.Msg: I suppose you might be watching your local market (like Ralphs of Whole Foods...), but the market that I watch, commonly known as the NYSE, did indeed react this week to the uncertainty of the fiscal cliff deal. Last week, when it looked like a deal was likely, the market flew. This last week, it dove on the uncertainty of the completely contrived and b.s. "fiscal cliff." And yes, we're going to get to take the entire roller coaster ride again over the debt ceiling argument that is coming...

Topic.Title: Futures are cripping up in Asia.

Message.Msg: I think you have hit the proverbial nail almost squarely on the head. All of the pundits seem to be screaming, "Sell if a deal doesn't get done. The market's going to crash! We're going to hit another recession." Are you kidding me? Give me a break. A deal is going to get done. Everyone who has half a brain knows that. Yet the market is diving because of the uncertainty. These are the types of opportunities that make millionaires. I'm in with both feet and I'm going to make a killing. Anyone who sells now will have truely earned the seller's remorse he, she or it will feel in three weeks...

Topic.Title: US stock futures are green!!

Message.Msg: You must be a contrarian. This is historically the strongest time of year for stocks. I would not look for a down market based on fiscal cliff and debt ceiling negotiations. Look at what's going on in housing. Look at the employment numbers. GDP was revised above 3% for Q3. Look at the actuall economic indicators (just a little hint -- the fiscal cliff and debt ceiling negotiations aren't), which are all looking good.

Topic.Title: BAC is a coiled spring!

Message.Msg: There will not be a fiscal cliff. Do you really think congress is not going to come to terms with all of this? Let me tell you something, none of them want to be seen as raising taxes on mostly anyone and certainly not on everyone. Right now, your friendly congress person is in the executive washroom shtting bricks trying to figure out how to get their #$%$ out of the frying pan. Of course, there will be a deal. Congress will enact whatever is necessary, albeit with all of this b.s. policking and posturing. Where the markets are concerned, we're probably just going to continue sideways or slightly down until they do announce a deal. However, when that deal is announced, irrational exuberance kicks in and the market rallies, led by BAC. That leads into the BAC earnings announcement in 1/17, which will be good. I really don't like to predict share prices, but my current positions are basedon what I expect the stock to do, which is to be closer to 13, possibly 14 and even 15 by the earnings announcement. This all leads up to March when the Fed announces Stress Test results. If BAC is allowed to up its dividend and/or do a share buyback, the stock could see 18.
